alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 7:42AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is starting the snow melt. High temperatures on Wednesday will range from the low 50s to the upper 60s in forested areas. This is expected to further ripen the snow pack and, with anticipated melting, will cause increased flows of water into the rivers resulting in rapid rises. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later toward the weekend, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Hawley. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. Railroad underpass at US Hwy 10 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 10.0 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
